result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane P. Houlihan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. - stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay fine/costs, Drug and DNA Surcharges.    If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Continue with current out patient treatments/programs.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.

timeConds.notes: Community Service and at least 1/2 to be served at the Portage County Parks Dept and the Green Circle Trail.

Same Huber. - Stayed

miscConds.notes: Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 1.

records.addlTxt:
9:52 a.m. Defendant Shane P. Houlihan in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed and reading waived.
 Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Amended Ct 1: I/S Sentence: 30 days each count, consecutive: 24 mo Probation w/conditions. Ct 1 pay $200 fine + costs and Ct 2 Pay costs.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest both counts.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc concurs with joint agreement.
Defendant makes statements. 

BY THE COURT:***********PROBATION**********
Amended Count 1: I/S Sentence: 30 days jail: Huber privileges: - stayed
24 mo Probation w/conditions. 
Continue with current out patient treatments/programs.  
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
50 hrs of Community Service and at least 1/2 to be served at the Portage County Parks Dept and the Green Circle Trail.
Ct 1 pay $200 fine + costs + Drug Surcharge + DNA surcharge.

Count 2:  I/S Sentence: 30 days jail, consecutive: Huber privileges: - stayed
24 mo Probation, concurrent.  Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1.  Pay costs and DNA surcharge.
Plea hearing on April 30, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

State files Information.
Parties agree to correction of the violation dates stated on the record.
BTC: Court amends violation dates on Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Court calls case at 3:32 
Defendant Shane P. Houlihan in court with attorney Anne Renc. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Molepski calls witness, Justin Klein, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.  Exhibit P#1: Lab Report is marked and referred to during direct exam. 
3:41 p.m. Exhibit P#1 is received by the Court.
3:42 p.m. Cross exam by Atty Renc.
3:45 p.m. Atty Renc final statements.
3:45 p.m. BTC:   Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form
Preliminary hearing on January 5, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

$2,000 sig bond:   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.   Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  on scheduled court dates.

Defendant Shane P. Houlihan in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits are waived for preliminary hearing.
